==Events==
* [[484]] &ndash; [[Huneric]] dies and is succeeded by his nephew [[Gunthamund]], who becomes king of the [[Vandals]]. During his reign the [[Catholicism|Catholics]] are free from persecutions.
* [[558]] &ndash; [[Chlothar I]] is crowned [[List of Frankish kings|King of the Franks]].
*[[562]] &ndash; [[Hagia Sophia]] in [[Constantinople]] reopened with a rebuilt dome after a series of [[earthquake]]s caused the original to collapse.
* [[583]] &ndash; Maya queen [[Yohl Ik'nal]] is crowned ruler of [[Palenque]].
* [[679]] &ndash; King [[Dagobert II]] is murdered while [[hunting]]. 
* [[962]] &ndash; [[Arab–Byzantine wars]]: Under the future [[List of Byzantine emperors|Emperor]] [[Nikephoros II Phokas|Nicephorus Phocas]], [[Byzantine army|Byzantine troops]] storm the city of [[Aleppo]].
*[[1572]] &ndash; Theologian [[Johann Sylvan]] executed in [[Heidelberg]] for his [[heresy|heretical]] [[Nontrinitarianism|Antitrinitarian]] beliefs.
*[[1688]] &ndash; As part of the [[Glorious Revolution]], King [[James II of England]] flees from England to Paris, France after being deposed in favor of his nephew, [[William III of England|William of Orange]] and his daughter [[Mary II of England|Mary]].
*[[1783]] &ndash; [[George Washington]] resigns as [[commander-in-chief]] of the [[Continental Army]] at the [[Maryland State House]] in [[Annapolis, Maryland]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Savenay]]: a decisive defeat of the [[House of Bourbon|royalist]] counter-revolutionaries in [[War in the Vendée]] during the [[French Revolution]].
*[[1823]] &ndash; ''[[A Visit from St. Nicholas]]'', also known as ''The Night Before Christmas'', is published anonymously.
*[[1876]] &ndash; First day of the [[Constantinople Conference]] which resulted in agreement for political reforms in the [[Balkans]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; The opera ''[[Hansel and Gretel (opera)|Hansel and Gretel]]'' by [[Engelbert Humperdinck]] is first performed.
*[[1913]] &ndash; The [[Federal Reserve Act]] is signed into law by [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]], creating the [[Federal Reserve System]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: Australian and New Zealand troops arrive in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; World War I: [[Battle of Magdhaba]] &ndash; [[Allies of World War I|Allied]] forces defeat [[Ottoman Empire|Turkish]] forces in [[Egypt]]'s [[Sinai Peninsula]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Sex Disqualification (Removal) Act 1919]] becomes law in the United Kingdom.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Visva-Bharati University]] is inaugurated.
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Colombia]] becomes a signatory to the [[Buenos Aires Convention|Buenos Aires]] [[copyright]] [[treaty]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; Discovery of the first modern [[coelacanth]] in South Africa.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Greek submarine Papanikolis (Y-2)]] sinks the Italian motor ship ''Antonietta''.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: After [[Battle of Wake Island|15 days of fighting]], the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] occupies [[Wake Island]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[transistor]] is first demonstrated at [[Bell Labs|Bell Laboratories]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; Seven [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] convicted of war crimes by the [[International Military Tribunal for the Far East]] are executed at [[Sugamo Prison]] in Tokyo, Japan.
*[[1954]] &ndash; First successful [[Kidney transplantation|kidney transplant]] is performed by [[J. Hartwell Harrison]] and [[Joseph Murray]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; Dedication of [[Tokyo Tower]], the world's highest self-supporting iron tower.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The 82 sailors from the {{USS|Pueblo|AGER-2|6}} are released after eleven months of internment in [[North Korea]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[List of tenants in One World Trade Center|North Tower]] of the [[World Trade Center]] in [[Manhattan]], [[New York City|New York, New York]] is topped out at {{convert|1368|ft|m}}, making it the tallest building in the world.
*  1970   &ndash; The [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] officially becomes a [[single-party state]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; A [[1972 Nicaragua earthquake|6.5 magnitude earthquake]] strikes the [[Nicaragua]]n capital of [[Managua]] killing more than 10,000.
*  1972   &ndash; The 16 survivors of the [[1972 Andes flight disaster|Andes flight disaster]] are rescued after 73 days, having survived by cannibalism.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Soviet war in Afghanistan]]: Soviet Union forces occupy [[Kabul]], the [[Afghanistan|Afghan]] capital.
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] announces it has identified dangerous levels of [[Dioxins and dioxin-like compounds|dioxin]] in the soil of [[Times Beach, Missouri]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; ''[[Rutan Voyager|Voyager]]'', piloted by [[Dick Rutan]] and [[Jeana Yeager]], lands at [[Edwards Air Force Base]] in [[California]] becoming the first aircraft to fly non-stop around the world without [[aerial refueling|aerial]] or ground refueling.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[History of Slovenia]]: In a [[Slovenian independence referendum, 1990|referendum]], 88.5% of [[Slovenia]]'s overall electorate vote for independence from [[Yugoslavia]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; An [[General Atomics MQ-1 Predator#Iraq|MQ-1 Predator]] is shot down by an Iraqi [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-25|MiG-25]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[PetroChina]] Chuandongbei natural gas field explosion, Guoqiao, [[Kai County]], [[Chongqing]], China, killing at least 234.
*[[2007]] &ndash; An agreement is made for the [[Kingdom of Nepal]] to be abolished and the country to become a [[federal republic]] with the [[List of Prime Ministers of Nepal|Prime Minister]] becoming head of state.
*[[2010]] &ndash; A monsoonal trough crosses the northeastern coast of Australia from the [[Coral Sea]], bringing [[2010–11 Queensland floods|mass flooding]] across Queensland.
